<item><title>Ebola, commodity price fall cost Guinea $500 mln in lost revenue</title><description>Guinea lost around $500 million in revenue in 2015 after an outbreak of the deadly Ebola virus and the drop in global commodity prices slowed growth and hurt the mining sector in the West African country, Prime Minister Mamady Youla said on Thursday. The country was one of three West African states at the centre of the outbreak, with more than 2,500 people in Guinea dying of the virus in 2014 and 2015. "Growth was zero in 2015," Youla told a press conference.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/ebola-commodity-price-fall-cost-guinea-500-mln-070428342--business.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:04:28 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">ebola-commodity-price-fall-cost-guinea-500-mln-070428342--business</guid></item><item><title>World's oldest person dies in New York City, aged 116</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/worlds-oldest-person-dies-york-city-aged-116-064332359.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/zvBrRPJAZXl8.WioS.efhA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T064332Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C099_RTROPTP_2_USA-NEW-YORK-OLDEST.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Susannah Mushatt Jones (C), known as &quot;Miss Susie&quot; is wheeled into a celebration for her 116th birthday with family members, local dignitaries, and friends in the Brooklyn borough of New York" align="left" title="Susannah Mushatt Jones (C), known as &quot;Miss Susie&quot; is wheeled into a celebration for her 116th birthday with family members, local dignitaries, and friends in the Brooklyn borough of New York" border="0" /></a>Jones&#039; death makes Emma Morano-Martinuzzi, a 116-year-old woman in Italy, the oldest living person, according to the Gerontology Research Group. Jones, who was born in the southern U.S. state of Alabama in 1899, was the daughter of sharecroppers and granddaughter of slaves. After graduating from high school she moved north in 1922 to New Jersey and then New York, where she worked as a housekeeper and childcare provider, according to Guinness World Records and the Vandalia Senior Center in the New York City borough of Brooklyn, where she lived.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/worlds-oldest-person-dies-york-city-aged-116-064332359.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:43:32 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">worlds-oldest-person-dies-york-city-aged-116-064332359</guid><media:content url="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/zvBrRPJAZXl8.WioS.efhA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T064332Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C099_RTROPTP_2_USA-NEW-YORK-OLDEST.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/worlds-oldest-person-dies-york-city-aged-116-064332359.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/zvBrRPJAZXl8.WioS.efhA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T064332Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C099_RTROPTP_2_USA-NEW-YORK-OLDEST.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Susannah Mushatt Jones (C), known as &quot;Miss Susie&quot; is wheeled into a celebration for her 116th birthday with family members, local dignitaries, and friends in the Brooklyn borough of New York" align="left" title="Susannah Mushatt Jones (C), known as &quot;Miss Susie&quot; is wheeled into a celebration for her 116th birthday with family members, local dignitaries, and friends in the Brooklyn borough of New York" border="0" /></a>Jones&#039; death makes Emma Morano-Martinuzzi, a 116-year-old woman in Italy, the oldest living person, according to the Gerontology Research Group. Jones, who was born in the southern U.S. state of Alabama in 1899, was the daughter of sharecroppers and granddaughter of slaves. After graduating from high school she moved north in 1922 to New Jersey and then New York, where she worked as a housekeeper and childcare provider, according to Guinness World Records and the Vandalia Senior Center in the New York City borough of Brooklyn, where she lived.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Ukraine's karate kids strike blow at Down's syndrome stereotypes</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/ukraines-karate-kids-strike-blow-downs-syndrome-stereotypes-064012284.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/bCtFA_jnLnCvYu3ADIypUw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/572a9f195e0badac75b59e78d00a73e75c81daa9.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Ten-year-old Denys Nazarenko (L), who has Down&#039;s syndrome, takes part in a local karate championship in Kiev, Ukraine" align="left" title="Ten-year-old Denys Nazarenko (L), who has Down&#039;s syndrome, takes part in a local karate championship in Kiev, Ukraine" border="0" /></a>Little Vova Tkachuk has difficulty speaking because of Down&#039;s syndrome but still loves practising devastating elbow strikes on the gym floor. The six-year-old boy has bravely overcome the inherent genetic disease and become one of Ukraine&#039;s latest karate kids -- a vibrant group of children challenging stereotypes that have held on for generations in the conservative ex-Soviet state. &quot;He still does not speak very well, but he gestures that he wants to go to karate,&quot; Vova&#039;s mother Maryna says, while helping him pull a white sports shirt over his head before he sets off to the exercise mat.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/ukraines-karate-kids-strike-blow-downs-syndrome-stereotypes-064012284.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:40:12 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">ukraines-karate-kids-strike-blow-downs-syndrome-stereotypes-064012284</guid><media:content url="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/bCtFA_jnLnCvYu3ADIypUw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/572a9f195e0badac75b59e78d00a73e75c81daa9.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/ukraines-karate-kids-strike-blow-downs-syndrome-stereotypes-064012284.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/bCtFA_jnLnCvYu3ADIypUw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/572a9f195e0badac75b59e78d00a73e75c81daa9.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Ten-year-old Denys Nazarenko (L), who has Down&#039;s syndrome, takes part in a local karate championship in Kiev, Ukraine" align="left" title="Ten-year-old Denys Nazarenko (L), who has Down&#039;s syndrome, takes part in a local karate championship in Kiev, Ukraine" border="0" /></a>Little Vova Tkachuk has difficulty speaking because of Down&#039;s syndrome but still loves practising devastating elbow strikes on the gym floor. The six-year-old boy has bravely overcome the inherent genetic disease and become one of Ukraine&#039;s latest karate kids -- a vibrant group of children challenging stereotypes that have held on for generations in the conservative ex-Soviet state. &quot;He still does not speak very well, but he gestures that he wants to go to karate,&quot; Vova&#039;s mother Maryna says, while helping him pull a white sports shirt over his head before he sets off to the exercise mat.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Philippines' cash-strapped cops cheer new crime-buster president</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/philippines-cash-strapped-cops-cheer-crime-buster-president-004727073.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/hPdQuxrAK.VhYA3lo93Jfw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T004727Z_1007000002_LYNXNPEC4C013_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-PHILIPPINES-ELECTION-CRIME.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Members of the Philippine National Police (PNP) Special Weapons And Tactics (SWAT) patrol along a main street of metro Manila in the Philippines" align="left" title="Members of the Philippine National Police (PNP) Special Weapons And Tactics (SWAT) patrol along a main street of metro Manila in the Philippines" border="0" /></a>By Karen Lema and Manuel Mogato MANILA (Reuters) - The police force in Manila is so underfunded that officers say they have to buy their own bullets and it is not uncommon for funeral service cars to give cops a lift along to murder scenes because they have no vehicles of their own. Enter Rodrigo Duterte, who won this week&#039;s presidential election in the Philippines on a single-issue campaign of crushing crime, corruption and drug abuse. Duterte&#039;s message, unpolished and peppered with profanities, tapped into popular alarm over a drug-fuelled jump in crime.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/philippines-cash-strapped-cops-cheer-crime-buster-president-004727073.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 01:19:53 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">philippines-cash-strapped-cops-cheer-crime-buster-president-004727073</guid><media:content url="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/hPdQuxrAK.VhYA3lo93Jfw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T004727Z_1007000002_LYNXNPEC4C013_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-PHILIPPINES-ELECTION-CRIME.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/philippines-cash-strapped-cops-cheer-crime-buster-president-004727073.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/hPdQuxrAK.VhYA3lo93Jfw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T004727Z_1007000002_LYNXNPEC4C013_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-PHILIPPINES-ELECTION-CRIME.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Members of the Philippine National Police (PNP) Special Weapons And Tactics (SWAT) patrol along a main street of metro Manila in the Philippines" align="left" title="Members of the Philippine National Police (PNP) Special Weapons And Tactics (SWAT) patrol along a main street of metro Manila in the Philippines" border="0" /></a>By Karen Lema and Manuel Mogato MANILA (Reuters) - The police force in Manila is so underfunded that officers say they have to buy their own bullets and it is not uncommon for funeral service cars to give cops a lift along to murder scenes because they have no vehicles of their own. Enter Rodrigo Duterte, who won this week&#039;s presidential election in the Philippines on a single-issue campaign of crushing crime, corruption and drug abuse. Duterte&#039;s message, unpolished and peppered with profanities, tapped into popular alarm over a drug-fuelled jump in crime.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>National project to harness microbes for health, environment</title><description>WASHINGTON (AP) — We share our bodies and our surroundings with teeming communities of microbes that are crucial to the health of people and the planet, and now the Obama administration is beginning a major project to better understand those invisible ecosystems — even control them.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/national-project-harness-microbes-health-environment-040225218--politics.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:02:25 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">national-project-harness-microbes-health-environment-040225218--politics</guid></item><item><title>China environment ministry given powers to inspect provinces: paper</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/china-environment-ministry-given-powers-inspect-provinces-paper-031148231.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/svhPcgOFhfNBSvTWH2781w--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T031148Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C03D_RTROPTP_2_CHINA-ENVIRONMENT.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="File photo of smoke rising from a chimney among houses as new high-rise residential buildings are seen under construction on a hazy day in the city centre of Tangshan" align="left" title="File photo of smoke rising from a chimney among houses as new high-rise residential buildings are seen under construction on a hazy day in the city centre of Tangshan" border="0" /></a>China&#039;s environment ministry has been given powers to send inspection teams to provinces and regions across the country as part of its efforts to root out local polluters, the official China Daily newspaper reported on Friday. The paper said the Ministry of Environmental Protection (MEP) would become only the second national authority, after the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection, China&#039;s corruption watchdog, to have the power to send inspection teams and hold discussions with provincial leaders.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/china-environment-ministry-given-powers-inspect-provinces-paper-031148231.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:11:48 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">china-environment-ministry-given-powers-inspect-provinces-paper-031148231</guid><media:content url="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/svhPcgOFhfNBSvTWH2781w--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T031148Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C03D_RTROPTP_2_CHINA-ENVIRONMENT.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/china-environment-ministry-given-powers-inspect-provinces-paper-031148231.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/svhPcgOFhfNBSvTWH2781w--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T031148Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C03D_RTROPTP_2_CHINA-ENVIRONMENT.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="File photo of smoke rising from a chimney among houses as new high-rise residential buildings are seen under construction on a hazy day in the city centre of Tangshan" align="left" title="File photo of smoke rising from a chimney among houses as new high-rise residential buildings are seen under construction on a hazy day in the city centre of Tangshan" border="0" /></a>China&#039;s environment ministry has been given powers to send inspection teams to provinces and regions across the country as part of its efforts to root out local polluters, the official China Daily newspaper reported on Friday. The paper said the Ministry of Environmental Protection (MEP) would become only the second national authority, after the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection, China&#039;s corruption watchdog, to have the power to send inspection teams and hold discussions with provincial leaders.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>New Alabama law could shutter two abortion clinics near schools</title><description>Alabama Governor Robert Bentley signed new abortion restrictions into law on Thursday, limiting the proximity of clinics to public schools and banning a procedure used to terminate pregnancies in the second trimester, local media reported. The Republican governor signed two anti-abortion laws, according to the Montgomery Advertiser and other local outlets. One prevents state health officials from issuing or renewing the licenses of abortion clinics within 2,000 feet of public schools serving students in grades kindergarten through eight.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/alabama-law-could-shutter-two-abortion-clinics-near-012011536.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:20:11 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">alabama-law-could-shutter-two-abortion-clinics-near-012011536</guid></item><item><title>Teaching cattle farmers in Uganda: 'Sometimes death is the only way'</title><description>Catherine Amerit is a livestock officer for the International Rescue Committee in Uganda. "My role is to improve the productivity of livestock for farmers in Karamoja in northeast Uganda, by teaching them the best way to look after their animals.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/teaching-cattle-farmers-uganda-sometimes-death-only-way-002118385.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:21:18 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">teaching-cattle-farmers-uganda-sometimes-death-only-way-002118385</guid></item><item><title>Joan Rivers' daughter settles malpractice lawsuit in mother's death</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/joan-rivers-daughter-settles-malpractice-lawsuit-mothers-death-233749753.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/2xRQDir5LflrMOyWNWP0nw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T233749Z_1006970001_LYNXNPEC4B1TK_RTROPTP_2_CENTERTAINMENT-US-PEOPLE-RIVERS.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Comedienne Joan Rivers and daughter Melissa Rivers attend the Elie Tahari Fall/Winter 2011 collection show during New York Fashion Week" align="left" title="Comedienne Joan Rivers and daughter Melissa Rivers attend the Elie Tahari Fall/Winter 2011 collection show during New York Fashion Week" border="0" /></a>A New York City clinic has settled a malpractice lawsuit filed by the daughter of comedian Joan Rivers for an undisclosed amount over an ill-fated procedure that led to the celebrity&#039;s death, lawyers for the Rivers family said on Thursday. Rivers, who was 81, suffered a loss of oxygen to her brain on Aug. 28, 2014, as physicians at the Yorkville Endoscopy center in Manhattan inserted instruments to examine her throat and vocal cords. &quot;In choosing to accept this settlement, I am able to put the legal aspects of my mother&#039;s death behind me and ensure that those culpable for her death have accepted responsibility for their actions quickly and without equivocation,&quot; Melissa Rivers said in a statement released by her lawyers, Ben Rubinowitz and Jeff Bloom.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/joan-rivers-daughter-settles-malpractice-lawsuit-mothers-death-233749753.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:37:49 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">joan-rivers-daughter-settles-malpractice-lawsuit-mothers-death-233749753</guid><media:content url="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/2xRQDir5LflrMOyWNWP0nw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T233749Z_1006970001_LYNXNPEC4B1TK_RTROPTP_2_CENTERTAINMENT-US-PEOPLE-RIVERS.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/joan-rivers-daughter-settles-malpractice-lawsuit-mothers-death-233749753.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/2xRQDir5LflrMOyWNWP0nw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T233749Z_1006970001_LYNXNPEC4B1TK_RTROPTP_2_CENTERTAINMENT-US-PEOPLE-RIVERS.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Comedienne Joan Rivers and daughter Melissa Rivers attend the Elie Tahari Fall/Winter 2011 collection show during New York Fashion Week" align="left" title="Comedienne Joan Rivers and daughter Melissa Rivers attend the Elie Tahari Fall/Winter 2011 collection show during New York Fashion Week" border="0" /></a>A New York City clinic has settled a malpractice lawsuit filed by the daughter of comedian Joan Rivers for an undisclosed amount over an ill-fated procedure that led to the celebrity&#039;s death, lawyers for the Rivers family said on Thursday. Rivers, who was 81, suffered a loss of oxygen to her brain on Aug. 28, 2014, as physicians at the Yorkville Endoscopy center in Manhattan inserted instruments to examine her throat and vocal cords. &quot;In choosing to accept this settlement, I am able to put the legal aspects of my mother&#039;s death behind me and ensure that those culpable for her death have accepted responsibility for their actions quickly and without equivocation,&quot; Melissa Rivers said in a statement released by her lawyers, Ben Rubinowitz and Jeff Bloom.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Thailand's opposition muted ahead of referendum</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/thailands-opposition-muted-ahead-referendum-231348415.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/7CLmxZKvneNhs8m4RyrknQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T231710Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1TA_RTROPTP_2_THAILAND-POLITICS.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="File photo of members of the Thai army taking part in Thailand&#039;s National Armed Forces Day at the Thai Army 11th Infantry Regiment in Bangkok" align="left" title="File photo of members of the Thai army taking part in Thailand&#039;s National Armed Forces Day at the Thai Army 11th Infantry Regiment in Bangkok" border="0" /></a>By Amy Sawitta Lefevre KHON KAEN, Thailand (Reuters) - In northeast Thailand, once a hotbed of opposition to Thailand&#039;s junta, troops patrol university campuses in Humvees and hold &quot;attitude adjustment sessions&quot; at military camps for those who don&#039;t toe the line. Two years after a military coup, the constrained opposition is struggling to mount a campaign against an Aug. 7 referendum on a junta-backed draft constitution, its first test of popularity since the May 2014 coup. The junta has imposed restrictions on even debating the draft constitution, which critics say could enshrine military power for years to come.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/thailands-opposition-muted-ahead-referendum-231348415.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:13:48 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">thailands-opposition-muted-ahead-referendum-231348415</guid><media:content url="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/7CLmxZKvneNhs8m4RyrknQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T231710Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1TA_RTROPTP_2_THAILAND-POLITICS.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/thailands-opposition-muted-ahead-referendum-231348415.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/7CLmxZKvneNhs8m4RyrknQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T231710Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1TA_RTROPTP_2_THAILAND-POLITICS.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="File photo of members of the Thai army taking part in Thailand&#039;s National Armed Forces Day at the Thai Army 11th Infantry Regiment in Bangkok" align="left" title="File photo of members of the Thai army taking part in Thailand&#039;s National Armed Forces Day at the Thai Army 11th Infantry Regiment in Bangkok" border="0" /></a>By Amy Sawitta Lefevre KHON KAEN, Thailand (Reuters) - In northeast Thailand, once a hotbed of opposition to Thailand&#039;s junta, troops patrol university campuses in Humvees and hold &quot;attitude adjustment sessions&quot; at military camps for those who don&#039;t toe the line. Two years after a military coup, the constrained opposition is struggling to mount a campaign against an Aug. 7 referendum on a junta-backed draft constitution, its first test of popularity since the May 2014 coup. The junta has imposed restrictions on even debating the draft constitution, which critics say could enshrine military power for years to come.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Arianna Huffington's Advice for Modern Distractions and The Sleep Revolution</title><description><p><a href="http://www.huffingtonpost.com/pedram-shojai/arianna-huffingtons-advic_b_9939060.html?ncid=txtlnkusaolp00000592"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/KkT2ZXSLatL1dsIcCwGBzA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cHhvZmY9NTA7cHlvZmY9MDtxPTc1O3c9MTMw/http://media.zenfs.com/en-US/homerun/huffingtonpost.com.rss/b1c2b06963397c2077af22b466219849" width="130" height="86" alt="Arianna Huffington&#039;s Advice for Modern Distractions and The Sleep Revolution" align="left" title="Arianna Huffington&#039;s Advice for Modern Distractions and The Sleep Revolution" border="0" /></a>(Video Via TheUrbanMonk.com)How important is sleep? Her sleep deprivation then...</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Post-war reconciliation can open wounds, deepen trauma: researchers</title><description>Reconciliation programs to bring together communities divided by conflict can re-open old wounds and deepen problems such as depression and trauma by reviving war memories, researchers said on Thursday. In the first study of its kind, the researchers analyzed the outcome of a reconciliation program in Sierra Leone between 2011 and 2012, a decade after the country ended its civil war, in which more than 50,000 people were killed and many tens of thousands more were mutilated or raped by fighters. The program, carried out across 100 villages, brought together victims who described violence they experienced and perpetrators who admitted to crimes and asked for forgiveness.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/post-war-reconciliation-open-wounds-deepen-trauma-researchers-220957306.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:09:57 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">post-war-reconciliation-open-wounds-deepen-trauma-researchers-220957306</guid></item><item><title>Senate sets votes on competing Zika funding plans</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/senate-leaders-offer-options-zika-response-funds-173617060--business.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/YaxHUf0nDwEYhEXxPSU.og--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T173617Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1IH_RTROPTP_2_HEALTH-ZIKA-FRIEDEN.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Aedes aegypti mosquitoes are seen at the Laboratory of Entomology and Ecology of the Dengue Branch of the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in San Juan" align="left" title="Aedes aegypti mosquitoes are seen at the Laboratory of Entomology and Ecology of the Dengue Branch of the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in San Juan" border="0" /></a>By Richard Cowan WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Three competing plans for battling a potential Zika virus outbreak in the United States were presented on the floor of the U.S. Senate on Thursday, as lawmakers tried to break an impasse pitting President Barack Obama against congressional Republicans. In February, Obama urged Congress to quickly approve $1.9 billion in emergency funds to deal with prevention and treatment of Zika virus, which the World Health Organization warns is spreading rapidly in the Americas. White House spokesman Josh Earnest welcomed &quot;any sort of forward momentum in Congress&quot; while continuing to push for the full $1.9 billion.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/senate-leaders-offer-options-zika-response-funds-173617060--business.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:04:13 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">senate-leaders-offer-options-zika-response-funds-173617060--business</guid><media:content url="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/YaxHUf0nDwEYhEXxPSU.og--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T173617Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1IH_RTROPTP_2_HEALTH-ZIKA-FRIEDEN.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/senate-leaders-offer-options-zika-response-funds-173617060--business.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/YaxHUf0nDwEYhEXxPSU.og--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T173617Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1IH_RTROPTP_2_HEALTH-ZIKA-FRIEDEN.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Aedes aegypti mosquitoes are seen at the Laboratory of Entomology and Ecology of the Dengue Branch of the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in San Juan" align="left" title="Aedes aegypti mosquitoes are seen at the Laboratory of Entomology and Ecology of the Dengue Branch of the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in San Juan" border="0" /></a>By Richard Cowan WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Three competing plans for battling a potential Zika virus outbreak in the United States were presented on the floor of the U.S. Senate on Thursday, as lawmakers tried to break an impasse pitting President Barack Obama against congressional Republicans. In February, Obama urged Congress to quickly approve $1.9 billion in emergency funds to deal with prevention and treatment of Zika virus, which the World Health Organization warns is spreading rapidly in the Americas. (AP Photo/Chris O&#039;Meara, File)" border="0" /></a>Prince&#039;s autopsy, particularly the toxicology report, may clarify whether prescription painkillers played any part in his death.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>U.S. lawmakers put pressure on EPA over handling of glyphosate review</title><description>By P.J. Huffstutter CHICAGO (Reuters) - U.S. lawmakers have asked the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to explain why it published - and then withdrew - documents related to its review of glyphosate, the chemical in Monsanto Co's Roundup herbicide, according to a letter seen by Reuters. The documents, which included a report that said glyphosate is not likely to be carcinogenic to humans, were posted by the EPA on April 29 and taken down from a website the government agency manages on May 2. The letter, sent from the agriculture committee of the U.S. House of Representatives, marks the latest salvo in an ongoing debate over the EPA's role and influence in U.S. agriculture.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/u-lawmakers-put-pressure-epa-over-handling-glyphosate-212746069--finance.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:27:46 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">u-lawmakers-put-pressure-epa-over-handling-glyphosate-212746069--finance</guid></item><item><title>Doping program behind Russian medals at Sochi Olympics: report</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/russians-sochi-olympics-were-part-doping-program-report-173127044--spt.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/z54JPgCXKsYqgEvSKpZ_9Q--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T191858Z_4_LYNXNPEC4B1KU_RTROPTP_2_SPORT-DOPING-RUSSIA.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Gold medal manufactured for 2014 Winter Olympic Games in Sochi is seen on display at Adamas jewellery factory in Moscow" align="left" title="Gold medal manufactured for 2014 Winter Olympic Games in Sochi is seen on display at Adamas jewellery factory in Moscow" border="0" /></a>(Reuters) - Dozens of Russian athletes who competed at the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics, including at least 15 medal winners, were part of a state-run doping program, the New York Times reported on Thursday. The report is broadly consistent with revelations by an independent World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) commission last November of widespread state-sponsored doping in Russia, which led to a ban on the country competing in international athletics competitions. According to the New York Times report, which is based largely on evidence from Grigory Rodchenkov, the director of the country&#039;s anti-doping laboratory during the Sochi Olympics, those involved included some of Russia’s biggest stars of the Games, including 14 members of its cross-country ski team and two veteran bobsledders who won two golds.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/russians-sochi-olympics-were-part-doping-program-report-173127044--spt.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:25:41 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">russians-sochi-olympics-were-part-doping-program-report-173127044--spt</guid><media:content url="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/z54JPgCXKsYqgEvSKpZ_9Q--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T191858Z_4_LYNXNPEC4B1KU_RTROPTP_2_SPORT-DOPING-RUSSIA.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/russians-sochi-olympics-were-part-doping-program-report-173127044--spt.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/z54JPgCXKsYqgEvSKpZ_9Q--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T191858Z_4_LYNXNPEC4B1KU_RTROPTP_2_SPORT-DOPING-RUSSIA.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Gold medal manufactured for 2014 Winter Olympic Games in Sochi is seen on display at Adamas jewellery factory in Moscow" align="left" title="Gold medal manufactured for 2014 Winter Olympic Games in Sochi is seen on display at Adamas jewellery factory in Moscow" border="0" /></a>(Reuters) - Dozens of Russian athletes who competed at the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics, including at least 15 medal winners, were part of a state-run doping program, the New York Times reported on Thursday. The report is broadly consistent with revelations by an independent World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) commission last November of widespread state-sponsored doping in Russia, which led to a ban on the country competing in international athletics competitions. According to the New York Times report, which is based largely on evidence from Grigory Rodchenkov, the director of the country&#039;s anti-doping laboratory during the Sochi Olympics, those involved included some of Russia’s biggest stars of the Games, including 14 members of its cross-country ski team and two veteran bobsledders who won two golds.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Car door windows don't stop UV rays</title><description>By Andrew M. Seaman (Reuters Health) - Car windows don't protect against harmful sun exposure, so it might be a good idea to wear sunglasses and sun block even while driving, a new study suggests. While windshields blocked the vast majority of ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun, car door windows offered varying levels of protection from the rays that are tied to cataracts and skin aging. "Some cars were as low as 50 percent blockage," said researcher Dr. Brian Boxer Wachler of the Boxer Wachler Vision Institute in Beverly Hill, California.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/car-door-windows-dont-stop-uv-rays-212511746.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:25:11 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">car-door-windows-dont-stop-uv-rays-212511746</guid></item><item><title>Republicans win Obamacare legal challenge, add to insurer concerns</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/u-judge-hands-win-republicans-obamacare-challenge-164636939.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/WusYEKChs5bWMk_YWMYtDw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T212255Z_3_LYNXNPEC4B1EI_RTROPTP_2_USA-CONGRESS.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Ryan hands the pen to Price after signing a bill repealing Obamacare at the U.S. Capitol in Washington" align="left" title="Ryan hands the pen to Price after signing a bill repealing Obamacare at the U.S. Capitol in Washington" border="0" /></a>A U.S. judge on Thursday handed a victory to congressional Republicans who challenged President Barack Obama’s signature healthcare law, ruling that his administration overstepped its constitutional powers relating to government spending. U.S. District Judge Rosemary Collyer, based in Washington, ruled that the administration cannot spend billions of dollars in federal funds to provide subsidies under the law known as Obamacare to private insurers without the approval of Congress.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/u-judge-hands-win-republicans-obamacare-challenge-164636939.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:22:55 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">u-judge-hands-win-republicans-obamacare-challenge-164636939</guid><media:content url="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/WusYEKChs5bWMk_YWMYtDw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T212255Z_3_LYNXNPEC4B1EI_RTROPTP_2_USA-CONGRESS.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/u-judge-hands-win-republicans-obamacare-challenge-164636939.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/WusYEKChs5bWMk_YWMYtDw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T212255Z_3_LYNXNPEC4B1EI_RTROPTP_2_USA-CONGRESS.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Ryan hands the pen to Price after signing a bill repealing Obamacare at the U.S. Capitol in Washington" align="left" title="Ryan hands the pen to Price after signing a bill repealing Obamacare at the U.S. Capitol in Washington" border="0" /></a>A U.S. judge on Thursday handed a victory to congressional Republicans who challenged President Barack Obama’s signature healthcare law, ruling that his administration overstepped its constitutional powers relating to government spending. U.S. District Judge Rosemary Collyer, based in Washington, ruled that the administration cannot spend billions of dollars in federal funds to provide subsidies under the law known as Obamacare to private insurers without the approval of Congress.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>How much palliative care breast cancer patients get may depend on race</title><description>By Lisa Rapaport (Reuters Health) - When women have advanced breast cancer, the amount of comfort-oriented care they receive at the end of life may depend on the color of their skin, a small U.S. study suggests. Researchers examined data from Medicare, the U.S. government health program for the elderly, for 752 white and 131 black patients with final-stage breast cancer who died from 2007 to 2012. Black women were 49 percent less likely to receive certain medications for symptom relief than white patients, and they were also 14 percent less likely to get hospice care aimed at improving quality of life in their final days, the study found.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/much-palliative-care-breast-cancer-patients-may-depend-212154452.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:21:54 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">much-palliative-care-breast-cancer-patients-may-depend-212154452</guid></item><item><title>Tell the FDA He called...</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Regeneron CEO says drug price critique by independent group unscientific</title><description>By Caroline Humer NEW YORK (Reuters) - Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Chief Executive Leonard Schleifer on Thursday took aim at an influential drug pricing watchdog, saying a critique of the company's new cholesterol lowering therapy was non-scientific. The Boston-based Institute for Clinical and Economic Review (ICER) last fall reviewed two new potent cholesterol drugs called PCSK9 inhibitors. It concluded that the treatments should cost about 67 percent less than the list prices set by Regeneron with partner Sanofi, and by Amgen Inc. Health insurers have refused to cover the cost of the treatments in most cases, intensifying a high-profile fight over rising drug prices.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/regeneron-ceo-says-drug-price-critique-independent-group-191914926--finance.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:19:14 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">regeneron-ceo-says-drug-price-critique-independent-group-191914926--finance</guid></item><item><title>Patient awareness of antibiotic resistance and its prevention is low</title><description>By Madeline Kennedy (Reuters Health) - Many people still do not know which infections can be treated with antibiotics, and doctors may not be warning their patients about the hazards of taking the drugs too often, a U.K. study suggests. Primary care doctors dispense most antibiotics, so they need to do a better job of educating patients about when antibiotics are really needed and the consequences of overusing the drugs, researchers say. “The more you take antibiotics the more bacteria in your body will become resistant, so the next time you really need an antibiotic for pneumonia or a kidney infection, for example, it may not be as effective,” said lead author Cliodna McNulty, head of the Primary Care Unit at Public Health England in Gloucester.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/patient-awareness-antibiotic-resistance-prevention-low-185845425.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:16:57 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">patient-awareness-antibiotic-resistance-prevention-low-185845425</guid></item><item><title>Sleeping With Technology: Harming Your Brain One Night at a Time</title><description><p><a href="http://www.huffingtonpost.com/dr-larry-rosen/sleeping-with-technology-_b_9934960.html?ncid=txtlnkusaolp00000592"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/wLrrR7XGlq5da0oxF_JlpQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cHhvZmY9NTA7cHlvZmY9MDtxPTc1O3c9MTMw/http://media.zenfs.com/en-US/homerun/huffingtonpost.com.rss/d352ede9e59f0499aeea882672638a19" width="130" height="86" alt="Sleeping With Technology: Harming Your Brain One Night at a Time" align="left" title="Sleeping With Technology: Harming Your Brain One Night at a Time" border="0" /></a>Here is an all-too-common scenario: Jeff and Mary put the kids to bed and settle down for the night to watch television. The organizations said their joint delivery was stopped at the last government checkpoint on the way into Daraya, on the outskirts of Damascus. The town is held by rebels and besieged by government forces.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/red-cross-says-aid-convoy-denied-entry-besieged-170745475.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:00:29 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">red-cross-says-aid-convoy-denied-entry-besieged-170745475</guid><media:content url="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/hVToNLfVG8CD._WSLOEIMw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T170815Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1GF_RTROPTP_2_SYRIA-CRISIS.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/red-cross-says-aid-convoy-denied-entry-besieged-170745475.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/hVToNLfVG8CD._WSLOEIMw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T170815Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B1GF_RTROPTP_2_SYRIA-CRISIS.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A man rides a bicycle past a damaged building in Daraya, near Damascus" align="left" title="A man rides a bicycle past a damaged building in Daraya, near Damascus" border="0" /></a>An aid convoy was refused entry to a besieged Syrian town on Thursday, the Red Cross and United Nations said, blocking what would have been the first supplies to its residents for more than three years. The organizations said their joint delivery was stopped at the last government checkpoint on the way into Daraya, on the outskirts of Damascus. The town is held by rebels and besieged by government forces.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Activists call on Darden to limit antibiotics, boost worker pay</title><description>By Lisa Baertlein LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Dozens of activist groups, emboldened by recent policy shifts at major U.S. restaurants, are demanding that Olive Garden owner Darden Restaurants Inc change its food and labor practices. McDonald's USA last year committed to a timeline for moving to chicken raised without antibiotics vital to fighting human infections and to boosting average hourly pay for about 90,000 workers in its company-owned restaurants. Darden has vowed to phase out meat from farm animals that are fattened up with antibiotics that are important to human medicine by the end of this year.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/activists-call-darden-limit-antibiotics-boost-worker-pay-185745511--finance.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:57:45 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">activists-call-darden-limit-antibiotics-boost-worker-pay-185745511--finance</guid></item><item><title>Oregon man's conviction for not changing diaper overturned</title><description>(Reuters) - An Oregon appeals court has wiped away a father's criminal conviction for not changing his son's diaper for at least 14 hours, overturning a jury's verdict that the man was guilty of mistreatment. The ruling by a three-judge panel on Wednesday found prosecutors in Lane County, south of Portland, failed to prove the dad, James Christopher Hickey, had failed to perform a diaper change for the boy on repeated occasions. As a result, evidence of a "single untimely diaper change was not sufficient to allow a jury to find" Hickey had not protected the child from future "bodily harm," the Oregon appeals court ruled in a 10-page opinion.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/oregon-mans-conviction-not-changing-diaper-overturned-184116673.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:41:16 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">oregon-mans-conviction-not-changing-diaper-overturned-184116673</guid></item><item><title>White House says any progress in Congress on Zika funding is 'welcome'</title><description>The White House said on Thursday it would welcome any progress made by the U.S. Congress toward striking a deal to provide funding to help fight the Zika virus. "I think at this point, given the delays and given the heightened stakes, we welcome any sort of forward momentum in Congress," White House spokesman Josh Earnest told reporters at a daily briefing.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/white-house-says-progress-congress-zika-funding-welcome-183931968--business.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:39:31 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">white-house-says-progress-congress-zika-funding-welcome-183931968--business</guid></item><item><title>Bacteria the yin and yang of dandruff, says study</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/bacteria-yin-yang-dandruff-says-study-182442029.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/xshi._3bdm_f7Z9tFmw8Rg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/Part-WAS-Was7725053-1-1-0.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Dandruff is the most common scalp disorder on the planet, a tonsorial bane for about half the world&#039;s population" align="left" title="Dandruff is the most common scalp disorder on the planet, a tonsorial bane for about half the world&#039;s population" border="0" /></a>Dandruff is not caused by a fungus, as many believe, but by an imbalance between two competing bacteria that naturally colonise the human scalp, according to a study released Thursday. Think of Propionibacterium and Staphylococcus as the yin and yang of healthy hair: when they hold each other in check, so too is dandruff held at bay. Dandruff is the most common scalp disorder on the planet, a tonsorial bane for about half the world&#039;s population.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/bacteria-yin-yang-dandruff-says-study-182442029.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:24:42 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">bacteria-yin-yang-dandruff-says-study-182442029</guid><media:content url="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/xshi._3bdm_f7Z9tFmw8Rg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/Part-WAS-Was7725053-1-1-0.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/bacteria-yin-yang-dandruff-says-study-182442029.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/xshi._3bdm_f7Z9tFmw8Rg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/Part-WAS-Was7725053-1-1-0.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Dandruff is the most common scalp disorder on the planet, a tonsorial bane for about half the world&#039;s population" align="left" title="Dandruff is the most common scalp disorder on the planet, a tonsorial bane for about half the world&#039;s population" border="0" /></a>Dandruff is not caused by a fungus, as many believe, but by an imbalance between two competing bacteria that naturally colonise the human scalp, according to a study released Thursday. VW aims to expand its electric-vehicle offerings in the United States to meet a growing demand for green cars and help restore its image, VW brand sales chief Juergen Stackmann said in an interview published on Thursday. &quot;A final agreement with U.S. authorities would certainly provide relief and, at the same time, give the go-ahead to look and plan ahead&quot;, Stackmann said.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/vw-eyes-u-emissions-deal-pushes-comeback-plans-141126787--finance.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:47:26 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">vw-eyes-u-emissions-deal-pushes-comeback-plans-141126787--finance</guid><media:content url="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/5W7Vn4W4B_T8Q7X6KSUWzw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T141126Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B14Q_RTROPTP_2_USA-ECONOMY.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/vw-eyes-u-emissions-deal-pushes-comeback-plans-141126787--finance.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/5W7Vn4W4B_T8Q7X6KSUWzw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T141126Z_1_LYNXNPEC4B14Q_RTROPTP_2_USA-ECONOMY.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A U.S. flag flutters in the wind above a Volkswagen dealership in Carlsbad, California" align="left" title="A U.S. flag flutters in the wind above a Volkswagen dealership in Carlsbad, California" border="0" /></a>Volkswagen hopes to reach a final settlement with the U.S. authorities over the diesel emissions scandal next month so that it can get moving on a recovery plan which will see the launch of several new crossover and electric vehicles, its sales chief said on Thursday. src="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lEnAOoSmgdROnogsBgXsxQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T123621Z_1007000001_LYNXNPEC4B0YV_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-SINGAPORE-MINISTER.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Heng Swee Kiat speaks during a news conference in Singapore" align="left" title="Heng Swee Kiat speaks during a news conference in Singapore" border="0" /></a>By Lee Chyen Yee and Anshuman Daga SINGAPORE (Reuters) - Singapore Finance Minister Heng Swee Keat suffered a stroke and collapsed during a cabinet meeting on Thursday and Deputy Prime Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam was named to cover his duties. Heng, 54, who had been tipped as a potential successor to Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, was recovering in hospital after surgery, the prime minister&#039;s office said. &quot;Deputy Prime Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam will be covering the duties of the minister for finance with immediate effect,&quot; it said in a statement.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/singapore-finance-minister-suffers-stroke-112550518--business.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:08:48 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">singapore-finance-minister-suffers-stroke-112550518--business</guid><media:content url="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lEnAOoSmgdROnogsBgXsxQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T123621Z_1007000001_LYNXNPEC4B0YV_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-SINGAPORE-MINISTER.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/singapore-finance-minister-suffers-stroke-112550518--business.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lEnAOoSmgdROnogsBgXsxQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-12T123621Z_1007000001_LYNXNPEC4B0YV_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-SINGAPORE-MINISTER.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Heng Swee Kiat speaks during a news conference in Singapore" align="left" title="Heng Swee Kiat speaks during a news conference in Singapore" border="0" /></a>By Lee Chyen Yee and Anshuman Daga SINGAPORE (Reuters) - Singapore Finance Minister Heng Swee Keat suffered a stroke and collapsed during a cabinet meeting on Thursday and Deputy Prime Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam was named to cover his duties. Heng, 54, who had been tipped as a potential successor to Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, was recovering in hospital after surgery, the prime minister&#039;s office said. &quot;Deputy Prime Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam will be covering the duties of the minister for finance with immediate effect,&quot; it said in a statement.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item></channel>
